授業方法:
Classes may be taught face-to-face when the activity restriction level is shifted to Level 3.
Students who may be away from KSC because of job hunting or other duties must maintain regular e-mail communications with Dr. DeChicchis. Most submissions of outlines and drafts will be via e-mail.
If students' schedules permit, there will be an outside meeting or retreat to present and discuss the theses.

トピック.授業計画1:
Senior year, Spring semester: Students formally propose their research topic or policy problem, and they elaborate the appropriate research or problem-solving methodology.
Senior year, Summer break: Students complete their library or field research. Students complete an outline of their graduation thesis.
Senior year, Autumn: Students present and discuss their research. Students submit their completed theses to Dr. DeChicchis via e-mail. Students submit printouts of their theses to the jimushitsu by the December deadline. In late January, depending on students' schedules, there may be a retreat to discuss the graduation theses.
トピック.授業外学習2: Each student will prepare a graduation thesis on his/her chosen research topic.

評価.学生による授業評価の方法Course Evaluation by Student: Please use the KGU intranet method to evaluate this course. (ネット利用 -- 所定のフォーマット)
成績評価Grading0: 評価基準等　Grading Criteria etc.
評価.成績評価Grading2:
備考　Note
There will be no final exam. The grade for the course will be comprehensive; it will be based on homework, participation in class meetings, on participation in outside meetings, and on the quality of the preliminary drafts of the thesis.

name: 【400】研究演習II　２３／Research Seminar 2
担当者: デキキス　ジョー（DECHICCHIS JOSEPH）
